title: Ex-PM Blair lays out 'advice' to Britain's new leader
Beryl bears down on Texas, where it is expected to hit after regaining hurricane strength
content: Hurricane Beryl, currently 330 miles southeast of Corpus Christi, will hit Texas Monday with 60 mph winds. Dan Patrick declared a disaster in 121 counties, with Refugio County's 6,700 residents evacuating. Fourth of July tourists are advised to leave Baffin Bay to Sargent. Mitch Thames emphasizes safety. Heavy rain and strong winds are anticipated, per Jack Beven.
summary: Hurricane Beryl, currently 330 miles southeast of Corpus Christi, will hit Texas Monday with 60 mph winds. Dan Patrick declared a disaster in 121 counties, with Refugio County's 6,700 residents evacuating. Fourth of July tourists are advised to leave Baffin Bay to Sargent. Mitch Thames emphasizes safety. Heavy rain and strong winds are anticipated, per Jack Beven.

title: Amtrak service between New York City and Boston restored after lightning causes malfunction
Sri Lanka to lift ban on foreign research vessels despite India's concerns
State of emergency declared in Russia's Voronezh region after Ukraine drone attack
content: A state of emergency was announced in parts of Russia's Voronezh region due to a warehouse fire ignited by a Ukrainian drone attack. No casualties reported, but ongoing risks remain. Air defense systems destroyed several drones, leading to the fire. Both Russia and Ukraine have been utilizing drones extensively since February 2022.
summary: A state of emergency was announced in parts of Russia's Voronezh region due to a warehouse fire ignited by a Ukrainian drone attack. No casualties reported, but ongoing risks remain. Air defense systems destroyed several drones, leading to the fire. Both Russia and Ukraine have been utilizing drones extensively since February 2022.

title: 14 killed, 9 missing after heavy rains trigger landslides in Nepal
content: Recent heavy rains have led to flash floods and landslides in Nepal and India, causing casualties and displacements. Climate change and increased road construction are cited as contributing factors. Authorities are working to locate missing individuals and provide assistance to affected regions.
summary: Recent heavy rains have led to flash floods and landslides in Nepal and India, causing casualties and displacements. Climate change and increased road construction are cited as contributing factors. Authorities are working to locate missing individuals and provide assistance to affected regions.

title: France's second round of elections: Far-right win or a hung parliament?
content: In the second round of the French parliamentary elections, voting commenced with the far-right National Rally aiming to strengthen its position, while President Emmanuel Macron's Renaissance party seeks a comeback. Following a significant first-round victory for Marine Le Pen's RN, polling indicates a potential shift in parliament's balance, with Macron's coalition and leftist forces aligning against the RN. If RN secures a majority, Jordan Bardella could become prime minister, potentially reshaping policies on immigration and Euroscepticism.
summary: In the second round of the French parliamentary elections, voting commenced with the far-right National Rally aiming to strengthen its position, while President Emmanuel Macron's Renaissance party seeks a comeback. Following a significant first-round victory for Marine Le Pen's RN, polling indicates a potential shift in parliament's balance, with Macron's coalition and leftist forces aligning against the RN. If RN secures a majority, Jordan Bardella could become prime minister, potentially reshaping policies on immigration and Euroscepticism.

title: 'Too many prisoners': UK PM Keir Starmer announces prison reform plans
American teen 'lured' by stranger in Germany found, reunited with family
Princess Kate Middleton sends heartfelt message to Andy Murray as his Wimbledon journey ends
content: Murray's final appearance at Wimbledon was cut short when his mixed-doubles partner, Emma Raducanu, withdrew from their scheduled match on Saturday evening due to wrist stiffness. In a rare Instagram post on the official account of the Prince and Princess of Wales, Kate, who is currently undergoing cancer treatment, shared a touching message to the tennis icon on Saturday, July 6.
summary: Murray's final appearance at Wimbledon was cut short when his mixed-doubles partner, Emma Raducanu, withdrew from their scheduled match on Saturday evening due to wrist stiffness. In a rare Instagram post on the official account of the Prince and Princess of Wales, Kate, who is currently undergoing cancer treatment, shared a touching message to the tennis icon on Saturday, July 6.

title: Italian painting once found on bus stop sells for record $22.3 million
content: Italian Renaissance master Titian's painting, "The Rest on the Flight into Egypt," found in a London bus stop, sold for $22.3 million at Christie’s, surpassing estimates. Depicting Jesus, Mary, and Joseph, the compact masterpiece measures 18.25 x 24.75 inches. Stolen by Napoleonic troops in 1809, it resurfaced after being stolen in 1995. Christie's UK Chairman praised its enduring allure and historical significance.
summary: Italian Renaissance master Titian's painting, "The Rest on the Flight into Egypt," found in a London bus stop, sold for $22.3 million at Christie’s, surpassing estimates. Depicting Jesus, Mary, and Joseph, the compact masterpiece measures 18.25 x 24.75 inches. Stolen by Napoleonic troops in 1809, it resurfaced after being stolen in 1995. Christie's UK Chairman praised its enduring allure and historical significance.

title: Pioneer fire near Washington state lake Chelan escalates level 3 evacuation
content: The Pioneer fire began June 8 near Lake Chelan, Washington, spreading to 7,100 acres with 14% containment, prompting Level 3 evacuations. A state of emergency was declared June 14. Conditions worsened July 4. Level 2 evacuations span Moore Point to Flick Creek, Hazard Creek to Safety Harbor, and Camas Creek to Mitchell Creek, posing significant risks.
summary: The Pioneer fire began June 8 near Lake Chelan, Washington, spreading to 7,100 acres with 14% containment, prompting Level 3 evacuations. A state of emergency was declared June 14. Conditions worsened July 4. Level 2 evacuations span Moore Point to Flick Creek, Hazard Creek to Safety Harbor, and Camas Creek to Mitchell Creek, posing significant risks.

title: Queen expected great-grandchildren to be 'more American' in last meeting, recalls Prince Harry
France is voting in key elections that could see a historic far-right win or a hung parliament
content: Sunday's snap elections in this nuclear-armed nation have potential impact on the war in Ukraine, global diplomacy and Europe's economic stability. And they're almost certain to undercut President Emmanuel Macron for the remaining three years of his presidency.
summary: Sunday's snap elections in this nuclear-armed nation have potential impact on the war in Ukraine, global diplomacy and Europe's economic stability. And they're almost certain to undercut President Emmanuel Macron for the remaining three years of his presidency.

title: Women fight Tokyo election in male-dominated Japan
content: Polls opened Sunday to elect a new Tokyo governor with incumbent Yuriko Koike challenged by opposition figure Renho, two prominent women in Japan's male-dominated political sphere. "I will implement genuine long-term fertility measures," said Renho, who is backed by Japan's main opposition parties.
summary: Polls opened Sunday to elect a new Tokyo governor with incumbent Yuriko Koike challenged by opposition figure Renho, two prominent women in Japan's male-dominated political sphere. "I will implement genuine long-term fertility measures," said Renho, who is backed by Japan's main opposition parties.

title: 1,500-year-old relic linked to Moses and the Ten Commandments discovered in Austria Chapel
content: Archaeologists from Innsbruck University discovered a 1,500-year-old ivory box, or pyx, within a marble shrine under an altar at a chapel on Burgbichl hill in Irschen, Austria. The pyx, adorned with Christian motifs, is tied to the biblical story of Moses receiving the Ten Commandments. Lead archaeologist Gerald Grabherr noted the rarity of such finds, with only around 40 known worldwide. The team also unearthed two Christian churches, a cistern, and personal belongings from the settlement.
summary: Archaeologists from Innsbruck University discovered a 1,500-year-old ivory box, or pyx, within a marble shrine under an altar at a chapel on Burgbichl hill in Irschen, Austria. The pyx, adorned with Christian motifs, is tied to the biblical story of Moses receiving the Ten Commandments. Lead archaeologist Gerald Grabherr noted the rarity of such finds, with only around 40 known worldwide. The team also unearthed two Christian churches, a cistern, and personal belongings from the settlement.

title: 105-year-old woman graduates from Stanford University after 83-year hiatus
Canada police charge Syrian returnee with terrorism offenses
content: Kimberly Polman, 51, charged by Canadian police with terrorism for allegedly joining ISIS in Syria in 2015. Facing two counts under Section 83 of the Criminal Code, she was repatriated in 2022 but not charged until now. The police statement released this information, and her lawyer commented at the time of her repatriation.
summary: Kimberly Polman, 51, charged by Canadian police with terrorism for allegedly joining ISIS in Syria in 2015. Facing two counts under Section 83 of the Criminal Code, she was repatriated in 2022 but not charged until now. The police statement released this information, and her lawyer commented at the time of her repatriation.

title: Sydney house fire kills three children, police suspect homicide
content: In Lalor Park, west of Sydney, a house fire at 1 am killed three children, aged two, four, and 10 months. A 28-year-old man was arrested. Homicide detectives, led by Danny Doherty, are investigating. The children's 29-year-old mother and four other children, aged six to 11, are stable in hospital due to smoke inhalation.
summary: In Lalor Park, west of Sydney, a house fire at 1 am killed three children, aged two, four, and 10 months. A 28-year-old man was arrested. Homicide detectives, led by Danny Doherty, are investigating. The children's 29-year-old mother and four other children, aged six to 11, are stable in hospital due to smoke inhalation.

title: Nato is spending more on defence, but it's likely not enough
